SENT.plain: Aplastic anemia (AA) is mediated by T-cell autoimmunity in the majority of cases; it is rare and mostly idiopathic in children
We describe a child, who developed AA following Graves' disease which could not be attributed to antithyroid drugs
We hypothesized that both diseases were caused by similar autoimmune process

We monitored the blood counts and did not administer any conventional treatment for AA assuming that the existing anti- hematopoietic stem cell humoral and cellular immunity might subside with induction of remission of Grave's disease
The child went into complete remission with the treatment of the Graves' disease
